title: Ezreal ahora aplica efectos de hechizos, y eso no apareció en las notas de versión

embed.description: So it applies Luden's, Rylai's, and Liandry's now. This is also the reason why it triggers Arcane Comet. This is a pretty big buff and it wasn't mentioned anywhere. Riot? Edit: If you are about to say that it always triggered these, please do 2 things first: Check the history

body:
**Lichbane + Lyandry's + Rylays + Runic Ecos en una sola Q, ¿Alguien me puede explicar porqué hicieron esto? No recuerdan que esto estuvo roto y por eso es que se cambió como funcionaba Runic Echoes para que no lo abusara Ezreal?**

Fuente: Foro de norteamérica

**Meddler: A lot of the thinking there was that, while this did technically buff those abilities, it was more because it opened up alternate approaches, than because it added power to existing playstyles. Builds generally go for AA effects or spell effects, more than mixing the two, given the way the items in question tend to be at least somewhat multiplicative with each other.

It also addressed an issue where a couple of champs were just blocked from taking Runes that should otherwise have been good and healthy fits for them (GP and Ez at least with Arcane Comet for example, I might be forgetting one or two more).

Finally, and this one's pretty secondary, but still a benefit worth mentioning, it also removed some long running player confusion around how those abilities functioned with some effects ('This item says all my abilities will now do X, but it doesn't work with this ability, what's up?). Edit: For examples of that sort of confusion, even from people engaged enough to be posting on Boards, see further down this thread.**
{{sticker:sg-lux-2}} {{sticker:sg-janna}} 


Esto es un cambio ENORME, Alguien leerá esto espero
